images.caption:
Figure 2:Using MLLMs for Visual Change Detection.
Given a set of images captured from nearby views at different timestamps (top row), we use an MLLM as a visual analyst to detect changes.

Figure 3:Trends of the Decade in New York City.
We discover interesting trends of visual change in NYC, including
745 new security cameras, 509 new fences around parking lots, and 519 red ADA warning pads on sidewalks.
For each example, the top row shows images before a change, bottom row shows after, and markers appear on the map where the changes occurred.

Figure 4:Trends of the Decade in San Francisco.
In San Francisco, we discover 1504 new solar panels (mostly in residential areas), 751 bus lanes conversions (mostly along a few major roads), and 1799 new bike racks (mostly near downtown).

Figure 5:NYC Retail Visual Trends.
By conditioning on
“a retail store has changed,“ we are able to discover visual trends related to the opening and closing of types of retail stores in New York.

Figure 6:Unusual Things on the Streets of NYC.
Beyond temporal queries, our system can also be applied to analyzing individual images, for non-temporal open-ended queries.
Here we show our findings from the individual image query “What are the unusual things in the image?”.
We find there are manyunusual“large, abstract” sculptures in NYC.

Figure 7:Where are new buildings in NYC?We plot all locations where we observe the trend, “A lot now has a multi-story building constructed on it”, in NYC.
We find notable clustering in Brooklyn, Long Island City, and Hudson Yards.

Figure 8:Many Graffiti Observed, 2020–2022. In SF since 2020, many new graffiti are observed.
A quick search on the Internet reveals relevant reports in local news and a local policy change.
The enforcement has since resumed.

Figure 12:Data Coverage.We show the region we sample our locations from in both cities in red.
Note that our data collection does not coverage the whole region of administration for both cities.
Figure 14:GPT-4o Predictions Without Images. (Accessed time: Nov. 2024)
